meanings.definition: A package containing two separate compartments or sections.
meanings.sent1: I bought a bipacks of gum, one side for me and one for my friend.
meanings.sent2: The store sells bipacks of batteries for convenience.
meanings.sent3: The bipacks of snacks looked like they were having a little party in my bag.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a bipacks, neatly storing memories in separate compartments.
meanings.sent5: The bipacks of crayons made coloring so much easier for the kids.

meanings.definition: To divide or separate into two parts or sections.
meanings.sent1: She bipacks her clothes before every trip to stay organized.
meanings.sent2: The chef will bipacks the ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: I bipacks my time between work and hobbies to stay balanced.
meanings.sent4: His decision to move out bipacks the family into two households.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will bipacks the students into two groups for the activity.
